basics.name: Bo Yang
basics.summary:
Hello! I am a recent graduate of Georgia Tech's Computer Science Master's program. You can read about my OMSCS experience in the blog linked below. 

 I will be starting a new role next month as a data engineer/structural engineer at WSP USA.

work.name: WSP
responsibilities: Build and maintain ETL pipeline using Azure stack
Build and maintain bridge inspection management software

work.name: Ingenimax
responsibilities: Developed and tested AI agent capabilities for automated infrastructure deployment
Implemented LLM query and chain of thought functionalities
Tested context fetching and integration with cloud platforms

work.name: South Col Engineering, P.C.
responsibilities: Inspect in-service bridges, perform structural analysis, compile inspection reports in NYSDOT's BDIS (Bridge Data Information System)

projects.name: Bridge Database Management App
description: A full-stack Flask application that uses a fine-tuned Google T5 transformer model for natural language querying of a bridge database
Model was trained and finetuned on a synthetic dataset of mapped queries to app/SQL query endpoints
Raw data with individual bridge location and structural data was processed into an SQLite database. Natural-language AI search implemented on top using a lightweight transformer.
Automated deployment via Github and Fly.io with CI/CD

projects.name: Spark in Rust
description: Simplified Apache Spark framework featuring distributed MapReduce with in-memory intermediate file processing, written in Rust
Parallel data processing and data partitioning managed via gRPC/Tokio crate. Master pods employ etcd leader election. Leader pod offers state replication to followers.
Worker mappers stream output data to master designated worker reducer nodes
Deployable over Azure Kubernetes Service or locally via kind
Includes CLI for package installation, Azure configuration, and reduce-output verification

projects.name: Lightweight Convolutional Neural Network
projects.description: Developed a distributed solver using PyTorch and Hugging Face Accelerate for parallel model training on GaTech's HPC cluster.
highlights: Implemented pruning methodology using Torch structured pruning and unstructured pruning techniques
Reduced model sizes by over half on various CNNs (DenseNet) while maintaining high inference accuracy
